talk07:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>A serious cold front, a food shortage, and
a ship floating in the sky in Rito Village...

Then, over in Goron City, the Gorons were
fixated on marbled rock roast and had
stopped working.
And someone who looked like <clr:0000>Princess
Zelda<clr:ffff> was connected to what happened
in both places...
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Whatever the case may be, I'm glad the
Rito and Gorons are able to get back to
business as usual.
Seems like entrusting those areas to you
was the right decision, after all.
talk_oasis007_04:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I'm sorry I wasn't able to properly greet
you sooner. I've been preoccupied with
my concerns for the princess.
talk_ZoraFencer_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>It is time for a new generation to lead the
way in Zora's Domain. I leave it to King
Sidon and Queen Yona to forge our path.
However, King Sidon also has his new
duties as a sage to attend to.

In his stead, we will proudly protect
Lookout Landing so that King Sidon can
devote himself to his newfound duties.
<sp:3:0:2:0700>In addition, we are preparing to embark
on a diligent inquiry into the <clr:0000>geoglyphs<clr:ffff>
that have appeared across Hyrule.
We will share any information we uncover
at once.

Of course, the kingdom is vast, so please
understand that it will take some time for
us to gather this information.
talk_Goron011_10:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Everyone's been saying Princess Zelda
might be in Hyrule Castle,<sp:5:1:0> but, I mean...

Princess Zelda, how did you get waaay
up there?
talk08:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>So the Gorons were fixated on something
called marbled rock roast and had
stopped working.
And someone resembling the princess was
manipulating Yunobo... <sp:3:0:2:0701>I was shocked
hearing that was happening in Goron City.
I'm relieved you were able to get things
back to normal there.
talk_oasis007_05:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>And while the Demon King may be a
daunting foe, I will not waver.
talk_ZoraFencer_02:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>It is time for a new generation to lead the
way in Zora's Domain. I leave it to King
Sidon and Queen Yona to forge our path.
However, King Sidon also has his new
duties as a sage to attend to.

In his stead, we will proudly protect
Lookout Landing so that King Sidon can
devote himself to his newfound duties.
<sp:3:0:2:0700>In addition, we are preparing to embark
on a diligent inquiry into the <clr:0000>geoglyphs<clr:ffff>
that have appeared across Hyrule.
We will share any information we uncover
at once.
talk38_12:
That was the princess...wasn't it?


<sp:3:0:2:0401>I was going to share that I saw a figure
that looked an awful lot like Princess
Zelda at Hyrule Castle!
I wasn't sure at first, but now I am.


I thought she'd left the castle entirely,
but she was inside!
talk09:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>King Dorephan was attacked by someone
resembling Princess Zelda, and sludge
was contaminating the Zora's water...
<sp:3:0:2:0701>The Zora rely on water for...well,
everything! Things could've gotten much
worse for them if you hadn't shown up.
I'm glad I trusted you with taking care of
things there, Linky.
talk38_13:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Sad_01>The soldiers and I can't reach <clr:0000>Hyrule
Castle <clr:ffff>as it is now.

<sp:3:0:2:0701>You might be the only one who can do it.
talk38_14:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Sad_00>Ugh, I'm sorry, Link. I know I'm always
throwing you into dangerous situations.

But you really are the only one up to
the task.

<sp:3:0:2:0701>Please, come back in one piece.<sp:5:1:0>


That applies to both you and the princess.
<sp:5:0:0>Got it?
talk10:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>So someone resembling the princess was
seen disappearing into the sand shroud.
Then there was the massive pyramid.
And the Gibdo attacks. <sp:5:0:0>Even the strength
of the Gerudo couldn't contend with all
of that.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>But now, because of you, things are back
to normal there. And some of the Gerudo
have come here to offer support.
Your help has had a tremendous impact.
Thank you.
talk_oasis007_08:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>What is it? I'm...thinking right now.


If you want Purah, she's up above. Don't
be so hasty to climb after her that you
miss a rung, OK?
talk11:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>A serious cold front, a food shortage, and
a ship floating in the sky in Rito Village...

Then in Zora's Domain, King Dorephan
was attacked, and sludge was raining
down from above.
And someone who looked like <clr:0000>Princess
Zelda<clr:ffff> was connected to what happened
in both places...
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Whatever the case may be, I'm glad the
Rito and Zora are able to get back to
business as usual.
Seems like entrusting those areas to you
was the right decision, after all.
talk_oasis007_09:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Our hands are a bit tied with her in a
place like...<sp:5:0:0>like THAT.

<sp:3:0:2:0701>Hm?
talk38_16:
<sp:3:0:2:0400>That was the princess...wasn't it?


I thought she'd left the castle entirely,
but she was inside!
talk12:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>A serious cold front, a food shortage, and
a ship floating in the sky in Rito Village...

Meanwhile, Gerudo Town was menaced by
Gibdos and a sand shroud, along with a
massive pyramid showing up...
And someone who looked like <clr:0000>Princess
Zelda<clr:ffff> was connected to what happened
in both places...
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Whatever the case may be, I'm glad the
Rito and Gerudo are able to get back to
business as usual.
Seems like entrusting those areas to you
was the right decision, after all.
talk13:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>From here, Eldin to the <clr:0000>northeast <clr:ffff>is
probably closest.
talk_oasis007_10:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>We'll fortify the <clr:0000>gates<clr:ffff> and seek out
<clr:0000>enemy weak points<clr:ffff> with the monster-
control crew.
You'll be the first one to know if we gain
any intel.
talk_ZoraFencer_08:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Though we may have a lead as to Princess
Zelda's whereabouts, I cannot assist in
any meaningful way. How shameful.
My joints are so weak at this point that
I cannot even reach the telescope where
Purah is located.
talk14:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>Monsters are pretty active to the south
anyway, so you're better off sticking
closer to here.<sp:5:0:0> You know?
talk_ZoraFencer_09:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>The Zora feel most free when surrounded
by water. That is also when we are most
effective.
Our intention is to use Hyrule's rivers and
waterways to investigate the <clr:0000>geoglyphs<clr:ffff>
that have been sighted across Hyrule.
Of course, the kingdom is vast, so please
understand that it will take some time for
us to gather this information.
talk15:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>Gerudo is on the <clr:0000>southwestern edge<clr:ffff>. It's
quite the trek from here.

You'd be wise to rest at the <clr:0000>stables<clr:ffff> along
the way.

<sp:3:0:2:0c00>So the Gorons were fixated on marbled

talk19:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>There are <clr:0000>three<clr:ffff> locations left.<clr:0000><clr:ffff>


Eldin to the northeast, Lanayru to the
east, and Gerudo region to the southwest.
talk20:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>It's become clear as day that there's a
connection between <clr:0000>Princess Zelda<clr:ffff> and
<clr:0000>the Upheaval<clr:ffff>.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Things are much more serious than I
previously thought. I need you to hurry
to the <clr:0000>remaining regions<clr:ffff>, and soon.
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>And we need to investigate the <clr:0000>other
village I'm concerned about<clr:ffff> too.
talk21:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>So in Zora's Domain, King Dorephan was
attacked, and sludge was coming down
from above.
Meanwhile, Gerudo Town was menaced by
Gibdos and a sand shroud, along with a
massive pyramid showing up...
And someone who looked like <clr:0000>Princess
Zelda<clr:ffff> was connected to what happened
in both places...
That must have been exceptionally
challenging, Link.

<sp:3:0:2:0700>But because of you, things are back to
normal there. And some of those you
helped are here now, offering support.
Your efforts have had a tremendous
impact. Thank you.
talk22:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>The major cold front that descended upon
the Rito, and the marbled rock roast that
the Gorons couldn't get enough of...
And finally, the sludge contaminating the
Zora's water supply.

All of these things connect to <clr:0000>Princess
Zelda<clr:ffff> somehow... Hm...

That must have been exceptionally
challenging, Link.

<sp:3:0:2:0700>But thanks to your efforts, some normalcy
has returned.

Entrusting those areas to you was the
right decision, after all.
talk_3_10:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I want you to look into these <clr:0000>four regions<clr:ffff>
where <clr:0000>strange phenomena<clr:ffff> are causing
major problems.
That's Hebra, <sp:5:0:0>Eldin, <sp:5:0:0>Gerudo, <sp:5:0:0>and Lanayru.


<sp:3:0:2:0c01>You might want to start with <clr:0000>Hebra<clr:ffff> <clr:0000>up in
the northwest<clr:ffff>, where <clr:0000>Princess Zelda <clr:ffff>was
supposedly sighted.

<sp:3:0:2:0c00>It's become clear as day that there's a

<sp:3:0:2:0701>Things are much more serious than I

talk_HighMountain009_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Oh, look who it is. I told Purah about all
that's happened at the village.

Without your guidance, I don't think Tulin
would have matured so much in such a
short time.
<snd:LaughS_01>Thank you, Link.


<sp:3:0:2:0001>Despite everything you helped with,<sp:5:1:0> we'd
still be helping to find Princess Zelda
either way.
We Rito are the obvious right pick for
scouring the skies. We'll be protecting the
skies and checking out the <clr:0000>sky islands<clr:ffff>.
talk24:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Anyway, if you need a refresher on what
to do, check your <clr:0000>Purah Pad<clr:ffff>.
talk_HighMountain009_02:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Oho, if it isn't Link. I failed to mention
this, but I told Purah about the village
earlier.
You helped Tulin grow so much during
your adventure together...

<snd:LaughS_01>For that, I am very grateful.


<sp:3:0:2:0001>We've all been talking about how best to
pitch in from here,<sp:5:1:0> and we'd like to help
with the search for Princess Zelda!
We Rito are the most obvious choice for
covering the sky territories. We'll guard
from above and check the <clr:0000>sky islands<clr:ffff>.
talk_3_12:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>You've got to be kidding... This is exactly
what you should be using your <clr:0000>Purah Pad<clr:ffff>
for. <sp:5:0:0>Did you forget or something?
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Well, I guess that's in character for you,
isn't it.

Can I see the Purah Pad?
talk25:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:TalkPositive>Oh! <sp:5:0:0>By the way, have you talked to
<clr:0000>Robbie<clr:ffff> yet?
talk26:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I'm leaving everything <clr:0000>Purah Pad<clr:ffff> related
to him.

He was going on and on about <clr:0000>ideas for
improvements <clr:ffff>with it. "This needs that,
and that needs this" and what have you.
If you haven't run into him yet, you should
go say hi.

<sp:3:0:2:0c00>The major cold front that descended upon

talk_3_16:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>What's going on?<sp:5:1:0>


<sp:3:0:2:0c01>For my part, I've been thinking a lot about
<clr:0000>this village <clr:ffff>aside from the <clr:0000>four regions<clr:ffff>
I asked you to check out.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I'm hoping to learn more about the

talk_3_17:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Think>Keep in mind Hebra is colder than usual
due to a <clr:0000>serious cold front<clr:ffff> that blew
in recently.
You'll want to show up <clr:0000>prepared with
cold-weather gear<clr:ffff>, otherwise you'll turn
into an icicle pretty quick.
talk_HighMountain009_08:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:QuestionSurprise_01>Oh, hey, Link. Have you heard?


<sp:3:0:2:0c01>Apparently Purah spotted a figure within
Hyrule Castle.

I flew off as soon as I could to try to
see who it might be, but I wasn't able
to discern anything, unfortunately.
<sp:3:0:2:0700>It must have been a false alarm. I got
so worked up, thinking it might be
Princess Zelda.
talk_3_18:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>Hiya, Linky. Popping by to make
an appearance?

I don't see any visible injuries...<sp:5:1:0> So you
must be holding up OK out there.

Have you made any progress on
investigating the <clr:0000>four regions<clr:ffff> like
I asked?
There's <clr:0000>another village that might
yield more answers<clr:ffff>, so I'm directing an
investigation into what's gone on there.

talk33:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>For Gerudo, the most direct route
is straight through the red <clr:0000>Gerudo
Highlands<clr:ffff>.
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>The temperature shifts there can be

It's a formidable place unless you're a

react quickly to the environment.
<sp:3:0:2:0001>I'm sure you'll figure it out.

talk35:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:PurahTalkSerious>Linky. Welcome back. I've been hearing
a lot about your adventures...
talk36:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Oh yeah, another thing. <clr:0000>Josha<clr:ffff> is recruiting
for the chasm-research team. She's been
struggling to find capable people to help.
She's young, but she's a real prodigy. She
outperforms most of the adults here, and
she's deeply committed to her research.
You might consider talking to her and
seeing if there's some way you can
pitch in.
talk39:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>It's easiest to show you on the <clr:0000>map<clr:ffff>. Can
you pull out your <clr:0000>Purah Pad<clr:ffff>?
talk_3_27:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><clr:0000>Kakariko Village<clr:ffff>, home of the <clr:0000>Sheikah
tribe<clr:ffff>. It's off to the southeast in the
Necluda region.
<clr:0000>Zonai ruins<clr:ffff>, each <clr:0000>shaped like a ring<clr:ffff>, fell
directly on top of the village.

<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Think>There's got to be a <clr:0000>special reason <clr:ffff>for it.


Right now, the Zonai Survey Team's
<clr:0000>elites <clr:ffff>are taking on the investigation.

If you want to know <clr:0000>about the Zonai<clr:ffff>, you
should talk to them.

<sp:3:0:2:0701>If you want more info...
talk_3_28:

I've also got that <clr:0000>other village on my

talk_3_31:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>He helps deploy the <clr:0000>monster-control-crew
squads <clr:ffff>to where they're needed and has
extensive geographical knowledge.
He can tell you more than I can about
various regions and peoples.
talk44:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Thanks to your help, it's become clear as
day that there's a connection between
<clr:0000>Princess Zelda<clr:ffff> and <clr:0000>the Upheaval<clr:ffff>.

talk_3_32:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>It's a relatively new place called <clr:0000>Tarrey
Town<clr:ffff> in Akkala, northeast of here.

<clr:0000>Hudson Construction<clr:ffff> is located there.
They're the same folks who built Lookout
Landing and the Skyview Towers.
For some reason, Zonai devices are <clr:0000>falling
near that area <clr:ffff>more than elsewhere.

<sp:3:0:2:0c00>There's got to be a <clr:0000>special reason <clr:ffff>for it.


<sp:3:0:2:0701>If you want more info...
talk20_1:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Thanks to your help, it's become clear as
day that there's a connection between
<clr:0000>Princess Zelda<clr:ffff> and <clr:0000>the Upheaval<clr:ffff>.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Things are much more serious than I
anticipated. You need to hurry to the
<clr:0000>remaining regions<clr:ffff>, and soon.
And we need to investigate the <clr:0000>other
place I'm concerned about<clr:ffff> too.
talk_3_33:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>It's a village in southeastern Hyrule called
<clr:0000>Hateno Village<clr:ffff>. It's one of the largest
Hyrulean villages there is.
Robbie and I have a <clr:0000>lab<clr:ffff> we use there as a
base for our research.

Fortunately that area hasn't been
bothered by random objects raining
down out of the sky.
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Although, there's been unrest in the
village, from what I've heard. Arguments
breaking out. Things like that.
Princess Zelda created a <clr:0000>school<clr:ffff> there
and was trying to use the village as a
starting point for restoring Hyrule.
Up until recently, it was a very peaceful
place, you see.<sp:5:1:0>

<sp:3:0:2:0701>If you want more info...
talk_3_34:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>It's a fishing village called <clr:0000>Lurelin Village<clr:ffff>
on the southeastern edge of Hyrule.

The village is currently overrun by <clr:0000>pirates<clr:ffff>.
Some villagers fled, while some stayed
put, so they're scattered all over.
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>I feel like I should've kept a closer watch
on that village. But it's far away, so news
from there to here doesn't travel quickly.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>If you want more info...
talk47:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>The major cold front that descended upon
the Rito, and the marbled rock roast that
the Gorons couldn't get enough of...
Then there was the sludge contaminating
the Zora's water, and finally, the Gerudo
menaced by Gibdos and a sand shroud.
<sp:3:0:2:0700>You faced some serious challenges, and
you overcame all of them. Well done, Link.

<sp:3:0:2:0c01>So...the person resembling <clr:0000>Princess Zelda<clr:ffff>
was behind the scenes for all of the
phenomena, as you discovered.
This HAS to be related to <clr:0000>the Upheaval<clr:ffff>
somehow.
talk_3_35:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Anyway, I can get help from the research
division for this.

<sp:3:0:2:0701>But I'm entrusting investigation of the
<clr:0000>remaining regions<clr:ffff> with the phenomena
to you.
talk48:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>And I have something important to share
as well.<sp:5:1:0>
talk49:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Think>You can reach Hebra by heading for the
snowy mountains to the northwest.

The cold out that way has gotten even
more intense since the Upheaval.

If you do head there, be sure to <clr:0000>prepare
well for the cold<clr:ffff>.
talk_Goron033_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>It's President Yunobo's friend!


President Yunobo told us to smash the
faces of any monsters that get into
<clr:0000>Lookout Landing<clr:ffff>.
He says face smashing is Goron tradition!
talk_3_37:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I'm leaving that region with phenomena
happening to you, so make me proud.

I've also got that <clr:0000>other village on my
mind<clr:ffff>. I'm working with the survey team
to look into what's going on there.
talk_3_38:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Anyway, I can get help from the research
division for this.

<sp:3:0:2:0701>But I'm entrusting investigation of the
<clr:0000>remaining region<clr:ffff> with the phenomena
to you.
talk50:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>There are <clr:0000>two<clr:ffff> locations left.<clr:0000><clr:ffff>


Hebra to the northwest and Lanayru to
the east.
talk51:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>There are <clr:0000>two<clr:ffff> locations left.<clr:0000><clr:ffff>


Hebra to the northwest and Gerudo to
the southwest.
talk_Goron033_04:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Even if that Demon King guy came, we'd
smash his face real good! So don't worry!
talk52:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>There are <clr:0000>two<clr:ffff> locations left.<clr:0000><clr:ffff>


Eldin to the northeast and Lanayru to
the east.
Near_ZoraFencer_03: Rain, on a day like this.
talk54:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>There are <clr:0000>two<clr:ffff> locations left.<clr:0000><clr:ffff>


Eldin to the northeast and Gerudo region
to the southwest.
talk_Goron011_02:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:LaughL>This place is AMAZING! There's so much
fun stuff to do around here! Whee!

...


<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseM>But just 'cause it's fun doesn't mean
we're spendin' all our time playing!

We're super busy scoutin' for bad guys!
talk_Goron011_03:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>We're scoutin' Lookout Landing like
Yuno— I mean PRESIDENT Yunobo told
us to!
It might be our first time outside
Goron City, but we take our job here
super seriously!
talk_Goron033_08:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Hey! It's President Yunobo's friend!
Listen to THIS!

I heard Princess Zelda might be in
Hyrule Castle!

<sp:3:0:2:0a00>But it's tough to see from here. <clr:0000>Ms. Purah<clr:ffff>
is so lucky with that fancy <clr:0000>scope <clr:ffff>of hers...
talk38_12_02: <sp:3:0:2:0401>We have to hurry and rescue her!<sp:5:1:0>
talk56:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>There are <clr:0000>two<clr:ffff> locations left.<clr:0000><clr:ffff>


Lanayru to the east and Gerudo region to
the southwest.
talk_Goron033_09:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>I want to see Princess Zelda myself, but
it's hard to see from here...

Ms. Purah's so lucky with that fancy
<clr:0000>scope <clr:ffff>of hers...
talk57:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>The last location is Hebra, to the
northwest.
talk_Goron011_05:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>So you can go look for Princess Zelda
without worrying.
talk58:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>The last location is Eldin, to the
northeast.
talk_Goron033_10:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>President Yunobo told us to smash the
faces of any monsters that get into
<clr:0000>Lookout Landing<clr:ffff>.
He says face smashing is Goron tradition!


But I'm kinda more interested in
exploring this place—there's so
many cool things here!
talk59: <sp:3:0:2:0700>The last location is Lanayru to the east.
talk_oasis007_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Now that Lady Riju has awakened as a
sage, Gerudo Town is unlikely to fall
to monsters.
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>I think of her often... I haven't left Lady
Riju's side in years, after all.

It's hard not to feel sad about it, but as
long as Lady Riju is moving forward, so
will I.
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:LaughS_00>We Gerudo will assist in the search for
Princess Zelda!

For now, we'll fortify the <clr:0000>gates<clr:ffff> and
seek out <clr:0000>enemy weak points<clr:ffff> with the
monster-control crew.
If we find anything out, I'll let you know.
talk60:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>The last location is the Gerudo region to
the southwest.
talk06:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>A serious cold front, food shortages, a
floating ship... And there was a sighting of
someone who looked like the princess!
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I had no idea things were that dire for
the Rito...

If you hadn't shown up to help out, who
knows what their fate would've been.
